intro: Arnanthus balansae, commonly known as the Balansae globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, globe-shaped yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Arnanthus balansae is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
